ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.1.2_0: At that time monks on probation consented to regular monks bowing down to them, standing up for them, raising their joined palms to them, doing acts of respect toward them, offering them a seat, offering them a bed, offering them water for washing their feet and a foot-stool, offering them a foot-scraper, receiving their bowl and robe, and massaging their backs when bathing.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.1.3_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.1.4_0: “How can monks on probation consent to these things?”
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.1.6_0: Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.1.7_0: “Is it true, monks, that monks on probation consent to these things?”
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.1.11_0: How can monks on probation consent to these things?
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.1.12_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.1.14_0: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.1.15_0: “A monk on probation should not consent to:
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.1.16_0: Regular monks bowing down to him;
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.1.17_0: Regular monks standing up for him;
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.1.18_0: Regular monks raising their joined palms to him;
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.1.19_0: Regular monks doing acts of respect toward him;
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.1.20_0: He should not consent to a regular monk offering him a seat.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.1.21_0: Regular monks offering him a bed;
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.1.22_0: Regular monks offering him water for washing his feet and a foot-stool;
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.1.23_0: Regular monks offering him a foot-scraper;
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.1.24_0: Regular monks receiving his bowl and robe;
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.1.25_0: Regular monks massaging his back when he is bathing.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.1.26_0: If he consents to any of these, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.1.27_0: Monks on probation should bow down to one another according to seniority, and likewise stand up, raise their joined palms, do acts of respect, offer a seat, offer a bed, offer water for washing the feet and a foot-stool, offer a foot-scraper, receive bowl and robe, and massage one another’s backs according to seniority when bathing.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.1.28_0: Monks on probation should do five things with regular monks according to seniority:
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.1.29_0: the observance-day procedure, the invitation procedure, sharing out of rainy-season robes, meal invitations, and meals.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.1.30_0: And I will lay down the proper conduct for resident monks.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.2.3_0: He should not give the full ordination.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.2.4_0: He should not give formal support.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.2.5_0: He should not have a novice monk attend on him.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.2.6_0: He should not accept being appointed as an instructor of the nuns.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.2.7_0: Even if appointed, he should not instruct the nuns.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.2.8_0: He should not commit the same offense as the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.2.9_0: He should not criticize the procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.2.10_0: He should not criticize those who did the procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.2.11_0: he should not cancel the observance-day procedure of a regular monk.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.2.12_0: He should not cancel the invitation procedure of a regular monk.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.2.13_0: He should not speak to a regular monk to initiate a legal process against him.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.2.14_0: He should not make accusations against a regular monk.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.2.15_0: A nun should not ask a monk for permission to accuse him of an offense.

ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.2.17_0: He should not remind a regular monk of an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.2.18_0: He should not associate inappropriately with other monks.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.2.19_0: He should not walk in front of a regular monk.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.2.20_0: He should not sit down in front of them.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.2.21_0: He should be given the last sea, the last bed, and the last dwelling of the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.2.21_1: That is why he should consent to.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.2.22_0: He should not attend on a regular monk when approaching families.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.2.23_0: He should not be attended on by a regular monk when approaching families.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.2.24_0: He should not undertake the practice of staying in the wilderness
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.2.25_0: One should not undertake the practice of almsfood.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.2.26_0: He should not have someone bring back almsfood for him because he doesn’t want others to know about his status.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.2.27_0: He should inform about his status when he is newly arrived in a monastery.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.2.28_0: He should inform new arrivals of his status.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.2.29_0: He should inform about his status on the observance-day.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.2.30_0: He should inform about his status on the invitation day.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.2.31_0: If he is sick, he should inform about his status by messenger.

ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.4.26_0: The sending back to the beginning
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.4.28_0: or as the twentieth member of a group, he rehabilitates, it is invalid and not to be done.”
ai-pli-tv-kd12:1.4.29_0: The ninety-four kinds of proper conduct for one on probation are finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:2.1.1_0: Soon afterwards Venerable Upāli approached the Buddha,
ai-pli-tv-kd12:2.1.4_0: “How many things are there, Venerable Sir, that stop a monk on probation from counting a particular day toward his probationary period?”
ai-pli-tv-kd12:2.1.6_0: he stays in the same room as a regular monk; he stays apart from other monks; he doesn’t inform other monks of his status.”
ai-pli-tv-kd12:2.1.7_0: These are the three such things, Upāli:
ai-pli-tv-kd12:3.1.1_0: On one occasion a large sangha of monks had gathered at Sāvatthī.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:3.1.2_0: The monks on probation were not able to fulfill their probationary duties.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:3.1.4_0: “I allow you to set aside the probation.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:3.1.5_0: And it should be done like this.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:3.1.6_0: The monk on probation should approach a monk, put his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say,
ai-pli-tv-kd12:3.1.9_0: or ‘I set aside the proper conduct.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd12:3.2.1_0: Soon afterwards the monks at Sāvatthī left in various directions.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:3.2.2_0: The monks on probation were again able to fulfill their probationary duties.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:3.2.4_0: “I allow you to take up the probation.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:3.2.5_0: And it should be done like this.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:3.2.6_0: The monk on probation should approach a monk, put his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say,
ai-pli-tv-kd12:3.2.9_0: or ‘I take up the proper conduct.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd12:3.2.11_0: The proper conduct of those on probation is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:4.1.1_0: At this time monks deserving to be sent back to the beginning consented to regular monks bowing down to them, standing up for them, raising their joined palms to them, doing acts of respect toward them, offering them a seat, offering them a bed, offering them water for washing their feet and a foot-stool, offering them a foot-scraper, receiving their bowl and robe, and massaging their backs when bathing.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:4.1.2_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-kd12:4.1.3_0: “How can monks deserving to be sent back to the beginning consent to these things?”
ai-pli-tv-kd12:4.1.5_0: Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd12:4.1.6_0: “Is it true, monks, that monks deserving to be sent back to the beginning consent to these things?”

ai-pli-tv-kd12:4.1.11_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”

ai-pli-tv-kd12:5.1.1_0: At this time monks deserving to be given the trial period consented to regular monks bowing down to them, standing up for them, raising their joined palms to them, doing acts of respect toward them, offering them a seat, offering them a bed, offering them water for washing their feet and a foot-stool, offering them a foot-scraper, receiving their bowl and robe, and massaging their backs when bathing.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:5.1.2_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-kd12:5.1.3_0: “How can monks deserving to be given the trial period consent to these things?”
ai-pli-tv-kd12:5.1.4_0: They then told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned them:
ai-pli-tv-kd12:5.1.5_0: “Is it true, monks, that monks deserving to be given the trial period consent to these things?”
ai-pli-tv-kd12:5.1.9_0: How can monks deserving to be given the trial period consent to these things?
ai-pli-tv-kd12:5.1.9_1: Regular monks massaging his back when he is bathing.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:5.1.10_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”
ai-pli-tv-kd12:5.1.12_0: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd12:5.1.13_0: “A monk deserving to be given the trial period should not consent to:
ai-pli-tv-kd12:5.1.14_0: Regular monks bowing down to him;
ai-pli-tv-kd12:5.1.15_0: Regular monks standing up for him;
ai-pli-tv-kd12:5.1.17_0: Regular monks massaging his back when he is bathing.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:5.1.18_0: If he consents to any of these, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:5.1.19_0: Monks deserving to be given the trial period should bow down to one another according to seniority, and likewise stand up, raise their joined palms, do acts of respect, offer a seat, offer a bed, offer water for washing the feet and a foot-stool, offer a foot-scraper, receive bowl and robe, and massage one another’s backs according to seniority when bathing.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:5.1.19_1: Regular monks massaging his back when he is bathing.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:5.1.20_0: Monks deserving to be given the trial period should do five things with regular monks according to seniority:
ai-pli-tv-kd12:5.1.21_0: the observance-day procedure, the invitation procedure, sharing out of rainy-season robes, meal invitations, and meals.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:5.1.22_0: And I will lay down the proper conduct for a monk deserving to be given the trial period.

ai-pli-tv-kd12:5.1.29_0: He should not sit down in front of them.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:5.1.30_0: He should be given the last sea, the last bed, and the last dwelling of the Sangha.

ai-pli-tv-kd12:6.1.19_0: He should not consent to a regular monk offering him a seat.

ai-pli-tv-kd12:6.1.29_0: And I will lay down the proper conduct for a monk undertaking the trial period.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:6.1.30_0: A monk undertaking the trial period should conduct himself properly.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:6.1.32_0: He should not give the full ordination.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:6.1.33_0: He should not give formal support.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:6.1.34_0: He should not have a novice monk attend on him.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:6.1.35_0: He should not accept being appointed as an instructor of the nuns.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:6.1.36_0: Even if appointed, he should not instruct the nuns.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:6.1.37_0: He should not commit the same offense as the offense for which the Sangha gave him the trial period, nor one that is similar or worse.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:6.1.38_0: He should not criticize the procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:6.1.39_0: He should not criticize those who did the procedure.

ai-pli-tv-kd12:6.1.42_0: He should not speak to a regular monk to initiate a legal process against him.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:6.1.43_0: He should not make accusations against a regular monk.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:6.1.44_0: A nun should not ask a monk for permission to accuse him of an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:6.1.45_0: He should not accuse a regular monk of an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:6.1.46_0: He should not remind a regular monk of an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:6.1.47_0: He should not associate inappropriately with other monks.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:6.1.48_0: He should not walk in front of a regular monk.

ai-pli-tv-kd12:6.1.63_0: He should not go from a monastery with monks to a non-monastery without monks, except together with a sangha or if there are dangers.

ai-pli-tv-kd12:7.1.1_0: Soon afterwards Venerable Upāli went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,
ai-pli-tv-kd12:7.1.3_0: “How many things are there, Venerable Sir, that stop a monk undertaking the trial period from counting a particular day toward his trial period?”
ai-pli-tv-kd12:7.1.5_0: he stays in the same room as a regular monk; he stays apart from other monks; he doesn’t inform other monks of his status; he travels without a group.”
ai-pli-tv-kd12:7.1.6_0: These are the four such things, Upāli:
ai-pli-tv-kd12:8.1.1_0: On one occasion a large sangha of monks had gathered at Sāvatthī.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:8.1.2_0: The monks undertaking the trial period were not able to fulfill their duties.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:8.1.4_0: “I allow you to set aside the trial period.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:8.1.5_0: And it should be done like this.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:8.1.6_0: The monk undertaking the trial period should approach a monk, put his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say,
ai-pli-tv-kd12:8.1.8_0: the trial period has been given up.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:8.1.9_0: or ‘I set aside the proper conduct.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd12:8.1.10_0: The Sangha has laid down the trial period.”
ai-pli-tv-kd12:8.1.11_0: Soon afterwards the monks at Sāvatthī left in various directions.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:8.1.12_0: The monks undertaking the trial period were again able to fulfill their duties.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:8.1.14_0: “I allow you to take up the trial period.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:8.1.15_0: And it should be done like this.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:8.1.16_0: The monk undertaking the trial period should approach a monk, put his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say,
ai-pli-tv-kd12:8.1.19_0: or ‘I take up the proper conduct.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd12:8.1.21_0: The proper conduct of those undertaking the trial period is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.1_0: At this time monks deserving rehabilitation consented to regular monks bowing down to them, standing up for them, raising their joined palms to them, doing acts of respect for them, offering them a seat, offering them a bed, offering them water for washing their feet and a foot-stool, offering them a foot-scraper, receiving their bowl and robe,
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.2_0: Regular monks massaging his back when he is bathing.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.3_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.4_0: “How can monks deserving rehabilitation consent to these things?”
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.6_0: Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.7_0: “Is it true, monks, that monks deserving rehabilitation consent to these things?”
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.11_0: How can monks deserving rehabilitation consent to these things?
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.11_1: Regular monks massaging his back when he is bathing.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.12_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.14_0: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.15_0: “A monk deserving rehabilitation should not consent to:
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.16_0: Regular monks bowing down to him;
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.18_0: Regular monks massaging his back when he is bathing.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.19_0: If he consents to any of these, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.20_0: Monks deserving rehabilitation should bow down to one another according to seniority, and likewise stand up, raise their joined palms, do acts of respect, offer a seat, offer a bed, offer water for washing the feet and a foot-stool, offer a foot-scraper, receive bowl and robe, and massage one another’s backs according to seniority when bathing.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.20_1: Regular monks massaging his back when he is bathing.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.21_0: Monks deserving rehabilitation should do five things with regular monks according to seniority:
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.22_0: the observance-day procedure, the invitation procedure, sharing out of rainy-season robes, meal invitations, and meals.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.23_0: And I will lay down the proper conduct for a monk deserving rehabilitation.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.24_0: “A monk deserving rehabilitation should conduct himself properly.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.26_0: He should not give the full ordination.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.27.1_0: He should not give formal support.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.28_0: He should not associate inappropriately with other monks.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.29_0: He should not walk in front of a regular monk.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.30_0: He should not sit down in front of them.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.31_0: He should be given the last sea, the last bed, and the last dwelling of the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.31_1: That is why he should consent to.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.32_0: He should not attend on a regular monk when approaching families
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.33_0: He should not be attended on by a regular monk when approaching families.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.34_0: He should not undertake the practice of staying in the wilderness
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.35_0: One should not undertake the practice of almsfood.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.36_0: He should not have someone bring back almsfood for him because he doesn’t want others to know about his status.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.37_0: He should not go from a monastery with monks to one without monks, except together with a regular monk or if there are dangers.

ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.74_0: The proper conduct of those deserving rehabilitation is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.75_0: The second chapter on those on probation is finished.

ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.103_0: If there is desire for you,

ai-pli-tv-kd12:9.1.114_0: There are two (aspects): this is the remaining.
